Job Position: Procurement Officer

Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a highly organized and proactive individual to manage procurement and inventory operations.
	The successful candidate will oversee the procurement of goods and services while ensuring the efficient receipt, storage, and distribution of pharmaceutical products.
	This role requires strong attention to detail, effective communication, and adherence to policies and regulations.

	Maintain accurate procurement records, contract files, and supplier information to support transparency, traceabilityand effective decision-making.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including finance, quality assurance, and warehouse operations, to forecast procurement needs and ensure uninterrupted product availability.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Management, or any social science degree
	Minimum of 1 year of experience in procurement andmanagement, preferably in the pharmaceutical industry.
	Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks.
	Knowledge of procurement regulations and inventory management systems.
	Ability to work effectively in a team and collaborate with other departments.





What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunities for professional growth and development.
	A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
	The chance to make a significant impact in a growing company.

  "description": "At Strivo Labs, we are passionate about helping businesses scale with speed and precision. We specialise in providing end-to-end digital solutions, from custom design and MVP development to automation and content creation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Junior Consultant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

About the Job


	Strivo Labs is seeking a highly driven Junior Consultant with strong technical capability and expertise in change management, leadership development, and organisational transformation.
	In this role, you will support strategy execution, deliver transformation projects, and provide analytical insights that drive meaningful business change across multiple industries.
	This role is ideal for a candidate with 2&ndash;5 years&rsquo; experience working with KPMG or similar top-tier consulting firms, either in Nigeria or abroad, who understands traditional consulting methodologies and is eager to support Senior Consultants and Partners in delivering technical and strategic solutions.


What You&rsquo;ll Do


	Support the design and implementation of organisational transformation and change management initiatives.
	Conduct change impact assessments, stakeholder analysis, and readiness assessments to guide transformation programs.
	Develop leadership development frameworks, competency models, training plans, and capability-building structures.
	Design and support rollout of change interventions including communications, training, transition management, and performance enablement.
	Perform data-driven analysis to support recommendations, insights, and solution design.
	Build dashboards, project trackers, and reporting mechanisms using tools such as Excel, PowerBI, Notion, Airtable, and Miro.
	Translate complex data and observations into actionable strategies for clients.
	Participate in client workshops, discovery sessions, and stakeholder engagements.
	Prepare high-quality proposals, presentations, reports, and project documentation.
	Support project management processes&mdash;tracking deliverables, risks, timelines, actions, and stakeholder expectations.
	Identify operational and process gaps, with recommendations for improvement.
	Contribute to the development of internal frameworks, methodologies, and intellectual property.
	Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams across transformation, digital, and operational projects.


Requirements
What We&rsquo;re Looking For:


	2&ndash;5 years of experience in management consulting, transformation, organisational development, or leadership development.
	Experience working in or with top-tier consulting firms (KPMG, Deloitte, PwC, EY, Accenture, or equivalent) is a strong advantage.
	Understanding of traditional consulting approaches and willingness to support Senior Consultants and Partners in technical and strategic delivery.
	Self-driven with an entrepreneurial mindset, strong ownership, and professionalism beyond typical firm levels.
	Demonstrated experience in change management, leadership development, or technology projects is a plus (upskilling possible if needed).
	Strong technical and analytical skills, with proficiency in Excel, data visualisation tools, Miro, and project management systems.
	Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder management skills.
	High adaptability, critical thinking, and ability to work in fast-paced and evolving environments.
	Bilingual candidates (English &amp; French) are a strong plus.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, salary expectation, and a short note about your experience to:&nbsp;hiring@strivolabs.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Junior Consultant Application&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Consultant

Job Location: Lagos

About the Job

	Strivo Labs is seeking a highly driven Junior Consultant with strong technical capability and expertise in change management, leadership development, and organisational transformation.
	In this role, you will support strategy execution, deliver transformation projects, and provide analytical insights that drive meaningful business change across multiple industries.
	This role is ideal for a candidate with 2–5 years’ experience working with KPMG or similar top-tier consulting firms, either in Nigeria or abroad, who understands traditional consulting methodologies and is eager to support Senior Consultants and Partners in delivering technical and strategic solutions.


What You’ll Do


	Support the design and implementation of organisational transformation and change management initiatives.
	Conduct change impact assessments, stakeholder analysis, and readiness assessments to guide transformation programs.
	Develop leadership development frameworks, competency models, training plans, and capability-building structures.
	Design and support rollout of change interventions including communications, training, transition management, and performance enablement.
	Perform data-driven analysis to support recommendations, insights, and solution design.
	Build dashboards, project trackers, and reporting mechanisms using tools such as Excel, PowerBI, Notion, Airtable, and Miro.
	Translate complex data and observations into actionable strategies for clients.
	Participate in client workshops, discovery sessions, and stakeholder engagements.
	Prepare high-quality proposals, presentations, reports, and project documentation.
	Support project management processes—tracking deliverables, risks, timelines, actions, and stakeholder expectations.
	Identify operational and process gaps, with recommendations for improvement.
	Contribute to the development of internal frameworks, methodologies, and intellectual property.
	Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams across transformation, digital, and operational projects.


Requirements
What We’re Looking For:


	2–5 years of experience in management consulting, transformation, organisational development, or leadership development.
	Experience working in or with top-tier consulting firms (KPMG, Deloitte, PwC, EY, Accenture, or equivalent) is a strong advantage.
	Understanding of traditional consulting approaches and willingness to support Senior Consultants and Partners in technical and strategic delivery.
	Self-driven with an entrepreneurial mindset, strong ownership, and professionalism beyond typical firm levels.
	Demonstrated experience in change management, leadership development, or technology projects is a plus (upskilling possible if needed).
	Strong technical and analytical skills, with proficiency in Excel, data visualisation tools, Miro, and project management systems.

	High adaptability, critical thinking, and ability to work in fast-paced and evolving environments.

  "description": "At Strivo Labs, we are passionate about helping businesses scale with speed and precision. We specialise in providing end-to-end digital solutions, from custom design and MVP development to automation and content creation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Loan Portfolio Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	The Loan Portfolio Specialist is responsible for monitoring, analyzing, and managing the performance of the organization&rsquo;s loan portfolio.
	The role ensures credit quality, compliance with internal policies and regulatory guidelines, and effective recovery strategies to maintain a healthy portfolio.


Key Responsibilities
Portfolio Management &amp; Monitoring:


	Track and analyze loan portfolio performance across all product segments.
	Identify early warning signals of credit deterioration and initiate proactive remedial action.
	Monitor delinquency trends, non-performing loans (NPLs), and recoveries.
	Prepare periodic reports on loan book health, segmentation, and performance metrics.


Credit Risk Analysis:


	Conduct portfolio stress testing, scenario analysis, and credit concentration assessments.
	Recommend credit limits, risk ratings, and provisioning based on regulatory requirements (e.g., CBN Prudential Guidelines).
	Support the implementation of internal credit risk models and risk appetite frameworks.


Loan Quality Assurance:


	Review loan documentation, collateral, and credit approvals for compliance.
	Ensure accurate classification of loans (Performing, Pass &amp; Watch, Substandard, Doubtful, Lost).
	Collaborate with credit and collections teams to enhance recovery processes.


Reporting &amp; Compliance:


	Prepare monthly and quarterly regulatory returns and internal credit portfolio reports.
	Ensure compliance with CBN, IFRS 9, and internal credit policy requirements.
	Provide insights and recommendations to management for policy and process improvement.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	Liaise with Finance, Risk, and Collections teams to align portfolio reporting and provisioning.
	Support management in investor, auditor, and regulatory reviews.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field.
	Minimum of 2&ndash;5 years of relevant experience in credit analysis, loan management, or risk management.
	Professional certification, such as ACA, ACCA, or CFA, is an advantage.
	Strong knowledge of credit risk metrics, NPL management, and regulatory frameworks (CBN, IFRS 9).
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, or other portfolio analytics tools.


Key Competencies:


	Analytical and quantitative skills.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy
	Sound judgment and decision-making ability.
	Excellent communication and reporting skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Integrity, professionalism, and accountability.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Job Position: Loan Portfolio Specialist

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Loan Portfolio Specialist is responsible for monitoring, analyzing, and managing the performance of the organization’s loan portfolio.
	The role ensures credit quality, compliance with internal policies and regulatory guidelines, and effective recovery strategies to maintain a healthy portfolio.


Key Responsibilities
Portfolio Management & Monitoring:


	Track and analyze loan portfolio performance across all product segments.
	Identify early warning signals of credit deterioration and initiate proactive remedial action.
	Monitor delinquency trends, non-performing loans (NPLs), and recoveries.
	Prepare periodic reports on loan book health, segmentation, and performance metrics.


Credit Risk Analysis:


	Conduct portfolio stress testing, scenario analysis, and credit concentration assessments.
	Recommend credit limits, risk ratings, and provisioning based on regulatory requirements (e.g., CBN Prudential Guidelines).
	Support the implementation of internal credit risk models and risk appetite frameworks.


Loan Quality Assurance:


	Review loan documentation, collateral, and credit approvals for compliance.
	Ensure accurate classification of loans (Performing, Pass & Watch, Substandard, Doubtful, Lost).
	Collaborate with credit and collections teams to enhance recovery processes.


Reporting & Compliance:


	Prepare monthly and quarterly regulatory returns and internal credit portfolio reports.
	Ensure compliance with CBN, IFRS 9, and internal credit policy requirements.
	Provide insights and recommendations to management for policy and process improvement.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	Liaise with Finance, Risk, and Collections teams to align portfolio reporting and provisioning.
	Support management in investor, auditor, and regulatory reviews.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or related field.
	Minimum of 2–5 years of relevant experience in credit analysis, loan management, or risk management.
	Professional certification, such as ACA, ACCA, or CFA, is an advantage.
	Strong knowledge of credit risk metrics, NPL management, and regulatory frameworks (CBN, IFRS 9).
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, or other portfolio analytics tools.


Key Competencies:


	Analytical and quantitative skills.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy
	Sound judgment and decision-making ability.
	Excellent communication and reporting skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Integrity, professionalism, and accountability.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, salary expectations, and a brief note about their experience to: hiring@strivolabs.com using “Loan Portfolio Specialist” as the subject of the email.
